Package org.jfree.data

Class RangeTest

java.lang.Object
org.jfree.data.RangeTest
class RangeTest extends Object
This class tests the Range class in JFree.data.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Bryce Carson

    expandThrowsIAEForNullRange()
    A simple test for the correct return value.
    void
    expandThrowsIAEWhenLowerGreaterThanUpper()
    This test is disabled because any combination of percentages which result in the lower bound of the new range being greater than the upper bound of the range would result in an IllegalArgumentException.class being thrown by Range(double, double) and hence the test would be redundant when illegalArgumentExceptionThrown() already tests this behavior.

    A simple, silly test for the Range.hashCode() method.
    void
    illegalArgumentExceptionThrown()
    The lower and upper bound arguments are reversed in this invocation intentionally.
    void
    intersectionBoundaryTruthTable()
    In order of their definition in the method below, the assertions are: An exact overlap of the ranges, An overlap of the lower boundary, An overlap of the upper boundary, An overlap within boundaries of the dispatching instance, An overlap, beyond both boundaries, Non-overlap beyond the upper boundary, Non-overlap before the lower boundary. Non-overlap, with illogical parameters, Non-overlap, again with illogical parameters.
    void
    rangeConstraintTruthTable()
    The missed branch is unreachable because the inner condition is unnecessary, and the code is unreachable.

  • Method Details

    • setup

      @BeforeAll public static void setup()
      This method initializes the static members of the test class.

    • illegalArgumentExceptionThrown

      @Test public void illegalArgumentExceptionThrown()
      The lower and upper bound arguments are reversed in this invocation intentionally.

      @Test public void rangeObjectHasCorrectAverage()

    • rangeObjectBoundsCorrect

      @ParameterizedTest @ValueSource(doubles={-10.0,0.0,10.0,100.0,110.0}) public void rangeObjectBoundsCorrect(double testValue)
      A simple arithmetical test of the constructor for Range(double, double) objects.
      Parameters:
      testValue - A value which should be contained by the static member range of the test class.

    • intersectionBoundaryTruthTable

      @Test public void intersectionBoundaryTruthTable()
      In order of their definition in the method below, the assertions are:
      1. An exact overlap of the ranges,
      2. An overlap of the lower boundary,
      3. An overlap of the upper boundary,
      4. An overlap within boundaries of the dispatching instance,
      5. An overlap, beyond both boundaries,
      6. Non-overlap beyond the upper boundary,
      7. Non-overlap before the lower boundary.
      8. Non-overlap, with illogical parameters,
      9. Non-overlap, again with illogical parameters.

    • rangeConstraintTruthTable

      @Test public void rangeConstraintTruthTable()
      The missed branch is unreachable because the inner condition is unnecessary, and the code is unreachable.

    • saneReturnValuesFromCombine

      @Test public void saneReturnValuesFromCombine()
      Tests that Range.combine(Range, Range) returns reasonable objects and values.

    • saneRangeObjectsReturnedFromExpandToInclude

      @Test public void saneRangeObjectsReturnedFromExpandToInclude()
      Technically, the specification does not imply that the same range object will be returned if the potential value to be included in the range is already contained by the range object. Therefore, assertEquals is used and not assertSame.

    • expandReturnsRangeObjectsForReasonableParameters

      @ParameterizedTest @ValueSource(doubles={0.0,0.1,0.25,0.5,0.75,1.0,1.25}) public void expandReturnsRangeObjectsForReasonableParameters(double percentage)
      This method is tested very simply because it is mostly arithmetic that doesn't need checking.
      Parameters:
      percentage - The percentage of the length of the Range object under test.
      See Also:
      • expandThrowsIAEForNullRange()
      • expandThrowsIAEWhenLowerGreaterThanUpper()

    • expandThrowsIAEForNullRange

      @Test public void expandThrowsIAEForNullRange()
      A simple test for the correct return value.

    • expandThrowsIAEWhenLowerGreaterThanUpper

      @Disabled @Test public void expandThrowsIAEWhenLowerGreaterThanUpper()
      This test is disabled because any combination of percentages which result in the lower bound of the new range being greater than the upper bound of the range would result in an IllegalArgumentException.class being thrown by Range(double, double) and hence the test would be redundant when illegalArgumentExceptionThrown() already tests this behavior.

    • hashCodeIsNotNull

      @Test public void hashCodeIsNotNull()
      A simple, silly test for the Range.hashCode() method.

    • toStringReturnsAString

      @Test public void toStringReturnsAString()
      A simple, silly test for the Range.toString() method.

    • equalsReturnsCorrectValues

      @Test public void equalsReturnsCorrectValues()
      A test of the Range.equals(Object) method.

    • shiftThrowsInvalidParameterExceptionCorrectly

      @Test public void shiftThrowsInvalidParameterExceptionCorrectly()
      Tests of the Range.shift(Range, double) method.

    • shiftWorksAsSpecified

      @Test public void shiftWorksAsSpecified()
      Tests that the boolean parameter is respected.
